text: Paphiopedilum ciliolare is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is known commonly as the short haired paphiopedilum. It is endemic to the Philippines.Rankou, H. 2015. Paphiopedilum ciliolare. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2015. Downloaded on 12 September 2015. This is a rare orchid with a total wild population of fewer than 2500 mature individuals. It is heavily collected for the horticulture trade and its forest habitat is threatened with destruction and degradation. This species is notoriously difficult to propagate. Germination media are most effective when they contain sugar and tryptone.Pierik, R. L. M., et al. (1988). Seed germination and further development of plantlets of Paphiopedilum ciliolare Pfitz. in vitro. Scientia Horticulturae, 34(1), 139-153. == References == ciliolare Category:Endangered plants Category:Endemic orchids of the Philippines Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Paphiopedilum ciliolare
